channel.title: Comments on: Using Terraform’s Azure provider (azurerm) with GitHub Actions and Terraform Cloud
channel.description: A blog about things I learn at the keyboard: DevOps, CI/CD, Cloud, Automation, to name a few....

item.title: By: Kuba
item.dc:creator: Kuba
item.description: Thanks a lot for this! I've tried all env variables combinations. Should get reported to HashiCorp for misleading errors, wasted hours on this.
item.content:encoded: Thanks a lot for this! I’ve tried all env variables combinations. Should get reported to HashiCorp for misleading errors, wasted hours on this.

item.title: By: Stephen Martin

item.description: Hello, Where are these settings, as I am running into this error. Thanks Stephen
item.content:encoded:

item.title: By: Haddrick
item.dc:creator: Haddrick
item.description: Also suitable, if needing to run remotely, to have environment variables stored in Terraform Cloud right?
item.content:encoded: Also suitable, if needing to run remotely, to have environment variables stored in Terraform Cloud right?

item.title: By: Jameson
item.dc:creator: Jameson
item.description: Bruh, you are the GOAT. I was beating my head against the wall for at least an hour on this.

item.title: By: John
item.dc:creator: John
item.description: Thank you for this. I sadly went down all the same roads ala SP before finding it but once I finally did it was my smoking gun. Saved me from hours of trying different versions of tf and az anyway :)
item.content:encoded: Thank you for this. I sadly went down all the same roads ala SP before finding it but once I finally did it was my smoking gun. Saved me from hours of trying different versions of tf and az anyway ðŸ™‚
